Key Match Events: Maharaj defended 10 runs in the last over, denying Bangladesh a win
Markram took a stunning running catch at long-on to secure the win for South Africa
Bangladesh needed 20 runs off 18 balls but could not get the death bowling away
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh have never beaten South Africa in a T20I
South Africa has an 8/8 record against Bangladesh
South Africa is in pole position to claim their spot in the Super Sixes
Bangladesh still has Nepal and Netherlands to play for qualification
Post-Match Reflections: Bangladesh fans in large numbers in New York supported their team
Aiden Markram's birthday was celebrated during the match
Anrich Nortje is one away from becoming the joint leading wicket-taker at the tournament
Bangladesh's top-order struggles continue, with only 39 runs between the top three
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa made it nine wins from nine games
Tanzid Hasan's four overs included 12 dot balls and picked up three wickets
Bangladesh's 13 runs in the last three overs of South Africa's innings was a key factor in their chase
Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller set the record for the highest fifth-wicket stand at Eisenhower Park
Tanzim Hasan's two wicket performance is a career-best for him
Others: The match was played in New York on June 10, 2024
The crowd at Eisenhower Park was approximately 22,658 spectators
Bangladesh needed 31 runs off 30 balls in the final over
South Africa's middle-order pair of Klaasen and Miller had a 79-run partnership
